licence_overview:
If you wish to carry out reserved legal activities as a legal executive you must be authorised.

A reserved legal activity is one of the following:

- exercising a right of audience
- conducting litigation
- reserved instrument, probate or notarial activities
- administering oaths

Authorisation is obtained from the [Chartered Institute of Legal Executives (CILEX).](http://www.cilex.org.uk/ "Chartered Institute of Legal Executives (CILEX)"){:rel="external"}

*[CILEX]: Chartered Institute of Legal Executives
